body:
### Hire a lawyer

A lawyer can be expensive but they’ll handle the legal aspects of the case and represent you in court.

They may try and negotiate a deal out of court with the other parent or recommend you move to step 2 straight away.

[Find a legal adviser](https://solicitors.lawsociety.org.uk/)

### Represent yourself

You may choose to represent yourself because you’d prefer to speak to the judge directly or because you can’t afford the legal fees.

If you can’t afford legal representation, you can still ask a lawyer for advice at any time during the court process.

GOV.UK has more information on [how to represent yourself in court](https://www.gov.uk/represent-yourself-in-court).

[Support Through Court](https://www.supportthroughcourt.org) provides help for every stage of the court process for those without a lawyer.

[Find a free legal advice clinic](https://www.lawworks.org.uk/legal-advice-individuals/find-legal-advice-clinic-near-you)
cost_description: Fees may vary depending on your location and the experience of the lawyer. How long you need will depend on your situation. Some lawyers offer free 30-minute consultations or fixed fees. You can also [check if you can get free legal help](https://weareadvocate.org.uk/apply-for-help.html).
heading: Choose to hire a lawyer or represent yourself
